title.narrative: OUTPUT 6.4: EMERGENCY COORDINATION, PREPARDNESS AND RESPONSE AND RESILENCE

description.narrative: Partners are well coordinated for multi-sectoral humanitarian assistance and have greater resilience capacity for crises., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, children, especially the poorest, the most excluded and those affected by crisis, have access to child-sensitive and shock- responsive social services, benefit from positive community practices and are empowered to be agents of change within their communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Partners are well coordinated for multi-sectoral humanitarian assistance and have greater resilience capacity for crises.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s Rapid Response program (UniRR) assisted;605,227;internally displaced persons (IDPs) including;349,216;children with NFI and WASH kits during the reporting period. In 2021, 83% of UNICEF interventions to children affected by population movement were;initiated;7;days after a rapid need assessment. UNICEF’s cholera response using a CATI (Case-Area Targeted Intervention) approach was successfully implemented during the reporting period and reached a total of;2,719;suspected cholera cases who received an appropriate and complete response within 48 hours of case notification through a responsive epidemiological surveillance system.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/12/2021
